title: Part A
stimulusHtml: One point for using one piece of evidence to support Judt’s argument regarding the creation of the welfare states. An implicit or explicit reference to Judt’s argument is necessary.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

One point for using one piece of evidence to support Judt’s argument regarding the creation of the welfare states. An implicit or explicit reference to Judt’s argument is necessary.

The student response earns one of the following points:

One point for using one piece of evidence to support Judt’s argument regarding the creation of the welfare states. An implicit or explicit reference to Judt’s argument is necessary.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: One point for using one piece of evidence to support Judt’s characterization of political AND/OR economic conditions in the period 1960−2000. An implicit or explicit reference to Judt’s characterization is necessary
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

One point for using one piece of evidence to support Judt’s characterization of political AND/OR economic conditions in the period 1960−2000. An implicit or explicit reference to Judt’s characterization is necessary

The student response earns one of the following points:

One point for using one piece of evidence to support Judt’s characterization of political AND/OR economic conditions in the period 1960−2000. An implicit or explicit reference to Judt’s characterization is necessary

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: One point for linking Judt’s argument to one political AND/OR intellectual trend in late twentieth-century Europe.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

One point for linking Judt’s argument to one political AND/OR intellectual trend in late twentieth-century Europe.

The student response earns one of the following points:

One point for linking Judt’s argument to one political AND/OR intellectual trend in late twentieth-century Europe.
